author: Septim_s
title: The proud racer
review:
This is the third set in the Shell 2014/2015 promotional series. This vehicle, the Ferrari 250 GTO is definitely worth every cent of your money. Read on to see why.

Box/Instructions

It is a standard polybag with the pullback motor function clearly shown in the bottom right portion. It showcases some fabulous artwork of a Ferrari testing track. 

The instructions are also quite simple and easy to follow.

Parts

This set comes with one relatively rare part and two extremely rare parts. Up to the date of writing, the element Angle Plate 1X2 / 2X4 (4648084) has only appeared in two other sets, namely:

  • 9485: Ultimate Race Set

  • 4430: Fire Transporter

These two sets only have one angle plate, making this the third set this element has appeared in. The roof (Roof/Top 4X5X1 1/3 No.1(6083870)) and the hood (Front 3X4X1 1/3 W/2 Knobs No.1(6083872) have only appeared in this set to date. There is also a pullback motor that has only been available in Shell sets.

The build

Very simple and very satisfying. However, you guys can be the judge of whether this car needs stickers to complete its look. Here's an image of the car with only the front sticker.

The completed model

It looks great. Lego has managed to get the scale right on this car. It definitely looks like the original.

Overall opinion

If you see this set, get it! You definitely won't regret it, unlike the 40195-1: Shell Station which is completely horrible, which you can find out why in my previous review.

author: Mateuseff
title: Ferrari 250 GTO
review:
Ótimo carro, pequeno, mais com poucas peças, mais de facil montage, 
um item colecionavel para iniciantes de facill aquisição. Recomendo.
